data.name: AutorunFoundMsg
data.value:
Autorun.inf file has not been found.
If you know you have an infected pendrive, insert it and rescan, after 10 seconds.
Or scan manually for any file, using the "I know this is a Virus: " Box.

data.name: MainFloppyMsg
data.value:
Continous scanning of floppy drive(s) is both time consuming, and could damage the floppy drive-head. For this reason... V.E.R.© ONLY SCANS THE FLOPPY ONCE! At the start and loading of V.E.R.©, this is to protect the floppy drive head!
We recommend that you add, any floppy drive(s) to V.E.R.©'s Ignore Drive List.
Would you like to add floppy drive(s) to the V.E.R.© Ignore List, now?
data.comment: message display when Floppy found at begining and not added to ignore list

data.name: hlpcFA_Run_remover
data.value:
Reset(s) ALL Windows© default tools and win update!
The vital tools in Windows® like regedit, taskmgr, Cmd (Command Prompt etc.) & AutoUpdate, are often disabled by viruses or trojans deliberately!
V.E.R.© fixes them for you! With just one Click!

data.name: hlpcFA_SFC
data.value:
Click Button. To RUN the Windows® System File Checker.
IMPORTANT NOTE: You MUST have your MASTER Windows®XP Installation (Holographic LOGOed ) CD/DVD to run this.
For more details on (sfc.exe) see PDF or Help file.

data.name: hlpcFA_Sys_Hidden_Show
data.value:
Shows you ALL suspicious files in your O/System folders.
Carefully, check any .bat, .cmd, .com, .dll, & .exe, files. Check online, any of the above, could be a virus infection!

data.name: msgFloppyCheckbox
data.value:
Continous scanning of floppy drive(s) is both time consuming, and could damage the floppy drive-head. For this reason... V.E.R.© ONLY SCANS THE FLOPPY ONCE! At the start and loading of V.E.R.©, this is to protect the floppy drive head!
We recommend that you to ignore, any floppy drive(s).
Would you like to add floppy drive(s) to the V.E.R.© Scan List, now?

data.name: hlpcFA_BlockAVirusbutton
data.value: Blocks a known virus, once you have confirmed the correct information, from sources on the internet.

data.name: hlpcFA_BrowseDir
data.value: Browse to the Folder, that you want to Scan.

data.name: hlpcFA_DDFileDetail
data.value: Show the file details, as per Windows® properties.

data.name: hlpcFA_delAF
data.value:
Delete ALL files in this Folder! ! Warning!
Use extreme Caution! When Deleting files.

data.name: hlpcFA_DeleteFileInList
data.value: Deletes selected, file(s).

data.name: hlpcFA_DelFileWithExt
data.value: Click, to Delete ALL files with specified extension(s).

data.name: hlpcFA_Enable_autorun
data.value:
Disable/Enable (On/Off) Windows® Autoplay files.
Turns on or off the autoplay for inserted media.
VSLab: Recommend that you turn Off 'Autoplay'! See V.E.R.© Help or PDF file for more detail.

data.name: hlpcFA_enable_msconfig
data.value:
Repair Windows® MSConfig, & then RUN it.
Use this Windows® tool, to modify your OS settings, for BOOTing and Startup.

data.name: hlpcFA_Enable_regedit
data.value:
Repair Windows® Registry Editor, & then RUN it.
Use this Windows® tool, to edit the registry. Take great care, when editing the registry!

data.name: hlpcFA_Enable_taskmgr
data.value:
Repair Windows® Taskmanager, & then RUN it.
Use this Windows® tool, to both view, &/or kill any suspect running processes. etc.

data.name: hlpcFA_EndButton
data.value: Shutdown V.E.R.© ALL it's scans & services, then EXIT.

data.name: hlpcFA_ExtBox
data.value:
Add extension(s) of file[s] here. E.g.
.txt .bmp .mp3

data.name: hlpcFA_FileAttributeApply
data.value: Applies the chosen attributes, to any selected file(s).

data.name: hlpcFA_Filenamebox
data.value: Type the filename, which you think may be a virus.

data.name: hlpcFA_FilesAllowedToDeleteBox
data.value: Add file(s) that should be Deleted, if and only if, (IFF) they are in the selected folder.

data.name: hlpcFA_FindCloneButton
data.value:
Finds cloned copies of a virus, that you might have found, using V.E.R.© or anti-Virus/anti-Tojan tools that you have.
This will enable you to trace & remove, any further copy or copies, of the virus (that may be) hidden, in other folders!

data.name: hlpcFA_find_autorun
data.value:
Disable/Enable Autorun.inf file(s) on devices.
VSLab: Recommend that you Disable Autorun.inf! See V.E.R.© help or PDF file for more details.

data.name: hlpcFA_FolderInfoButton
data.value: Use to get full file or folder details. You can find specific types of files, with non-standard attributes.

data.name: hlpcFA_FolderOptionsButton
data.value:
Gives user, back control of the Windows® Folder Options.
Using this button, starts Windows® Folder Options Window.

data.name: hlpcFA_GenerateprocessListButton
data.value:
Generates a current, running processes list.
Which is then displayed, in Windows® Notepad.
This allows you to track & trace any errant or 'nasty' processes, that should NOT be there!

data.name: hlpcFA_GetdrvProperty
data.value: Displays, the current drive properties.

data.name: hlpcFA_GetRemovalMedia
data.value: Detects ALL removable media ( i.e. Pen Drive) connected to OS.

data.name: hlptFA_GroupPolicyEditerToolStripMenuItem
data.value: Allows you authority, to edit Group Policy Objects, which can be linked to a Site, Domain, or Organisation Unit, in the Active folder, or stored on a computer.

data.name: hlpcFA_HideButton
data.value: Send To Tray & Minimize, V.E.R.© then moves to the background, ALL V.E.R.©'s services & scans.

data.name: hlpcFA_HideDriveButton
data.value: Hides drive(s) from Windows® Explorer & V.E.R.©.

data.name: hlpcFA_InfBox
data.value:
Shows present Autorun.inf file, in each USB drive.
Selecting these file(s) you can obtain information about, any associated processes and other file(s).

data.name: hlptFA_MakeRegisrtyBackupToolStripMenuItem
data.value:
Click, to make a partial - Registry backup.
Note: It only stores SOME sensitive registry data, in a special type of backup file, only for V.E.R.©.

data.name: hlpcFA_MaximizeButton
data.value: Maximize V.E.R.©. Make V.E.R.© fill current display.

data.name: hlpcFA_MediaInfoButton
data.value:
Click this Button to obtain removable media detail.
Using this button, you can unHide any virus files, etc. Which may be a virus, or viral-like in their activities.

data.name: hlpcFA_MinimizeButton
data.value: Minimizes V.E.R.© To the Windows® Taskbar.

data.name: hlpcFA_onehit
data.value: Click this, and you can Delete all the shown file(s) and any associated processes (to it) with one click.

data.name: hlpcFA_OnlySystemHidden
data.value: Show ALL files, in current selected path, with both System + Hidden attributes set.

data.name: hlpcFA_OptionButton
data.value: V.E.R.© configuration, and it's RUNNING options area.

data.name: hlpcFA_ProcessCommandLine
data.value: The Command Line of a process, is the run or loading instruction, for that process.

data.name: hlpcFA_Protectdrive
data.value:
When you click on this Button, V.E.R.© will then create a special protected folder named "AutoRun.inf" on your USB drive(s) & your hard-drive(s) partitions.
Prevents future infections, of the Autorun.inf type.

data.name: hlpcFA_RefreshButtonMain
data.value: Refreshes the Virus Effect Remover© Status.

data.name: hlpcFA_RemoveSystemHidden
data.value:
Click to remove files, with these attributes.
This only Deletes 'S+H' attribute files, ANY Hidden ONLY attribute files, are NOT Deleted!

data.name: hlpcFA_RenameFileInList
data.value:
Renames the selected filename, to "Renamed "+"Original filename."
Warning! Use Caution! When renaming any files, are they needed?

data.name: hlptFA_RestoreBackupToolStripMenuItem
data.value:
Restore previous Partial - Registry backup to optimal.
Note: Restores only SOME special registry data, back that you backed up, with the V.E.R.© Registry backup.

data.name: hlpcFA_RunNewProcessButton
data.value: The same as Windows® RUN command, runs despite virus or trojan!

data.name: hlpcFA_scanagain
data.value: Using this Tab you can rescan any process and it's associated files. If you think, it may be a virus.

data.name: hlpcFA_ScanServiceButton
data.value: This lists ALL the running services/processes in your OS.

data.name: hlpcFA_ScanStartupButton
data.value: Scans, and then lists ALL the Startup items in your OS.

data.name: hlpcFA_SecurityPermissionsButton
data.value: Provides you the authority to modify NTFS file permissions, of files or folders. For Very ADVANCED* Windows users only!

data.name: hlpcFA_ShowAllFile
data.value: Shows ALL files, in the current selected path.

data.name: hlpcFA_ShowAllHiddenFile
data.value: Show ALL files in selected path, with Hidden attribute set.

data.name: hlpcFA_ShowAlllSytemFile
data.value: Show ALL files in selected path, with System attribute set.

data.name: hlpcFA_ShowFolderOption
data.value:
Click to open the Windows© OS Folder Options.
Use this button, if you suspect that your OS Folder Options, might have been disabled.

data.name: hlpcFA_UnlockModuleButton
data.value: You can Unlock any module, associated with a process, even, WITHOUT terminating, that process itself.

data.name: hlpcFA_USBStorageDeviceOption
data.value:
Toggle on/off, the detection of ANY OS USB storage device.
Useful to prevent others, from infecting your Windows® OS.

data.name: hlpcFA_VisualiseAllFile
data.value:
Viruses HIDE using the OS Hidden+System attributes.
Click this button to REVEAL ANY such 'S+H' files, if ANY file appears, and then disappears again.
Then YOU KNOW it's a virus & "Live & Active" in OS!

data.name: msgEnableProcessFilter
data.value:
You are now trying to disable Process filter. This will NOT protect you from system termination.
We strongly recommend that you, ENABLE Process filter! Despite our recommendation, do you still want to disable, Process filter?

data.name: hlpcFA_AddStartup
data.value: Adds V.E.R©. to the Windows® Startup list.

data.name: hlpcFA_send2tray
data.value: This sends V.E.R.© application to background at startup.

data.name: hlpcFA_Help_box
data.value: Tick to disable, the bubble-help tool-tips.

data.name: hlpcFA_IGN_CDROM
data.value: Any Autorun.inf file(s) present in CD or DVD will be ignored.

data.name: hlpcFA_ScanTime
data.value: Set the V.E.R.© background Refresh time interval.

data.name: hlpcFA_EnableProcessFilter
data.value: It is highly recommended that you Enable process filter! This protects the OS, from improper process termination.

data.name: hlpcFA_CheckBox6
data.value: Sets the V.E.R.© Process List, refresh interval.

data.name: hlpcFA_CheckBox4
data.value:
V.E.R.© will scan drives A: & B:
VSLab: Recommend, you ONLY turn this on, while you are scanning floppy diskettes.

data.name: hlpcFA_GroupBox12
data.value: Selects the V.E.R.© colour theme.

data.name: hlpcFA_GroupBox8
data.value: You can run any program(s) from here. This is similar to, the New Task option in Task Manager.

data.name: hlpcFA_RenameIEButton
data.value: Some virus(s) modify the Internet Explorer Title Bar. Users can cure these changes, by using this button.

data.name: hlpcFA_CommandPromptButton
data.value: Open the Command Prompt (CMD) Window.

data.name: hlpcFA_DXDiagButton
data.value: Runs the DirectX Diagnostic Tool.

data.name: hlpcFA_MSInfoButton
data.value:
Run the, (OS) System Information Tool.
Note: Not installed in all Windows® OSes!

data.name: hlpcFA_FileProtectorButton
data.value:
Use File Protector popup, to set any type of file attribute. For protecting valuable files, by making them READ only. etc.
Or this tool can be used to REMOVE file attributes, that you DO NOT want on a file, or file(s), folder, or folder(s) etc.

data.name: hlpcFA_WCleanButton
data.value: Run the V.E.R.© Windows Cleaner tool.

data.name: hlpcFA_AutorunBox1
data.value: Shows Autorun.inf file, & any information about it's Status.

data.name: hlpcFA_CheckBox1
data.value: Tick if you want to Delete all Autorun.inf file, with just one click.

data.name: hlpcFA_FileFoundLV
data.value: This list will display file(s) associated with the Autorun.inf file, or the scanned file name.

data.name: hlpcFA_ProList
data.value: This list will display all processes using file, with the same name.

data.name: hlpcFA_KillThis
data.value: Kills the currently selected process. Or if more than just one process is ticked, kills all ticked.

data.name: hlpcFA_ProcessDetailList
data.value: Display complete details of currently selected process.

data.name: hlpcFA_CheckBox2
data.value:
Tick this if you want to Delete the parent file of the process.
Warning! Use extreme caution, when Deleting multiple files!

data.name: hlpcFA_ModuleList
data.value: Display associated module(s) with the current selected process.

data.name: hlpcFA_ShowHideFile
data.value: Show any Hidden Files and Folders.

data.name: hlpcFA_SystemHided
data.value: Show any System + Hidden Files and Folders.

data.name: hlpcFA_FileExt
data.value: Display file extension with file name.

data.name: hlpcFA_BT1
data.value: Browse to the file(s) to Delete.

data.name: hlpcFA_BR2
data.value: Browse to a Folder.

data.name: hlpcFA_IncSd1
data.value: V.E.R.© will recursively Delete all files in all child folder(s).

data.name: hlpcFA_REDir1
data.value: V.E.R.© will Delete any empty folder, if found at current location.

data.name: hlpcFA_DelAllEmptyDir
data.value: This will Delete all empty folder(s) of current selected Folder.

data.name: hlpcFA_IncSubDir2
data.value: V.E.R.© will recursively Delete all files, with the specified extension(s) in all child folders.

data.name: hlpcFA_DelEmptyDir2
data.value: V.E.R.© will Delete any empty folder, if found in current location.

data.name: hlpcFA_RecycleBinBox
data.value:
Sends all Deleted file(s), to the Windows® Recycle Bin.
Note : Sending file(s) to Recycle bin is a time consuming process. This could or likely will take additional time to complete!

data.name: hlpcFA_FDel
data.value: Force Delete file(s) and folder(s) by gaining the NTFS Security, & searching as module of any running process.

data.name: msg_FileDoesNotExist
data.value: File does not exist.

data.name: msg_FolderDoesNotExist
data.value: Folder does not exist.

data.name: msg_PathDoesNotExist
data.value: Path does not exist.

data.name: hlpcFA_DisableExitDialog
data.value:
If this box is ticked, then V.E.R.© will NOT then popup, an exit confirmation box.
Exit selection, happens immediately!
